result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian C. CONJURSKI was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • PTC Conspiracy to Commit Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Conspiracy], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • PTC Conspiracy to Commit Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Conspiracy], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: PTC Conspiracy to Commit Burglary-Building or Dwelling

supervisions.notes: to commence upon the completion of the sentence on Count 8 and consecutie to sentence presently serving on 08 CF 169.

miscConds.notes: Pay as follows:   Dana Konkle $40.00; Dennis Hartlaub $1,000.00; Hastings Mutual Ins. $624.50; Linda Pekarek $1,000.00; State Farm Ins. $2,2229.24; Peter Vanderkinter $500.00 and American Family Ins. $5,957.62, joint and several with anyone else prosecuted and convicted.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time employment or work search.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Have no contact with the victims, Dana Konkle, Dennis Hartlaub, Linda Pekarek, Richard Thomsen, Gary and Sharon Roethle and Peter Vanderkinter or their premises.   

Have no storage or rental facility in the defendant's name or rented by another person for the defendant's use.  

Submit DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: Adam Snavely, through Public Defender.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 08-12-15 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant is to have no contact with Linda Pekarek, Richard Thompsen, Dennis Hartlaub and Peter Vanderkinter and defendant must report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours.  Bail not furnished.  Defendant refused to sign.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.   Copy filed.
